parameters.name: weaviate_version
parameters.description: It is recommended to always use the latest version. You can also select an older version for compatibility sake, but not all features might be available on an older version.

options.name: v1.32.7
options.description: Latest stable release with all features

options.name: v1.30.0
options.description: Runtime config management, Dynamic user management, Dynamic RAG model selection

options.name: v1.25.0
options.description: Stable version with Ollama support

parameters.name: weaviate_volume
parameters.description: It's recommended to set a persistent volume to avoid data loss and improve reading and writing speeds.

options.name: named-volume
options.description: Docker will create a named volume called weaviate_data and mount it to the container.

options.name: host-binding
options.description: Docker will mount ./weaviate_data on the host to the container. Note that a volume ./weaviate_data must exist.

options.name: no-volume
options.description: Not recommended: You will not set a persistent volume. Data may be lost on container restart.

parameters.name: modules
parameters.description: Would you like to include modules or run Weaviate as a standalone vector database?

options.name: standalone
options.description: You will provide your own vectors and use Weaviate as a pure vector database.

options.name: modules
options.description: You can configure modules in the next step and feed specific media types into Weaviate which can then be vectorized using the right module.

parameters.name: media_type
parameters.description: Configure the media type, such as text, images, etc. to use with the Vectorizers & Retrievers Modules inside Weaviate.

options.name: text
options.description: Weaviate will turn your text (or code) objects to vectors at import and search time. Supports transformers, openai, contextionary and others.

options.name: image
options.description: Weaviate will vectorize your images at import and at search time.

options.name: image,text
options.description: Weaviate will have the capabilities to vectorize both text and images. You can decide which vectorizer to use on a class-by-class basis.

parameters.name: text_module
parameters.description: Select the text vectorization module for your Weaviate instance.

options.name: text2vec-transformers
options.description: The transformers (e.g. BERT, etc.) module reaches the highest accuracy, but requires GPUs to run efficiently.

options.name: text2vec-openai
options.description: Sends your text objects to OpenAI for embedding inference. Requires a valid OpenAI API key.

options.name: text2vec-cohere
options.description: Sends your text objects to Cohere for embedding inference. Requires a valid Cohere API key.

options.name: text2vec-ollama
options.description: Sends your text objects to Ollama container for embedding inference. Configurator adds bare ollama container.

parameters.name: transformers_model
parameters.description: Each model can have specific advantages and disadvantages. Models are typically either English-only or multi-lingual.

options.name: sentence-transformers-multi-qa-MiniLM-L6-cos-v1
options.description: Sentence-Transformer recommendation for best accuracy/speed trade-off. Specifically trained for semantic search.

options.name: sentence-transformers-all-MiniLM-L12-v2
options.description: All-purpose model. Best accuracy/speed trade-off for a general purpose model, but not specifically trained for semantic search.

options.name: sentence-transformers-paraphrase-multilingual-MiniLM-L12-v2
options.description: Currently the Sentence-Transformer recommendation for best accuracy/speed trade-off for a multi-lingual model.

parameters.name: openai_key_approval
parameters.description: OpenAI is a commercial service independent of Weaviate. You will need to register with OpenAI. The docker-compose file will read your API key from an environment variable OPENAI_APIKEY.

options.name: yes
options.displayName: Yes, I understand. I will set the environment variable myself.
options.description: I will set the correct environment variable prior to starting up the docker-compose setup.

options.name: no
options.displayName: Yes, I understand. I will provide the key with each request.
options.description: No environment variable placeholder will be added. I will provide the key with each request using the X-OpenAI-Api-Key header.

parameters.name: cohere_key_approval
parameters.description: Cohere is a commercial service independent of Weaviate. You will need to register with Cohere. The docker-compose file will read your API key from an environment variable COHERE_APIKEY.

options.name: yes
options.displayName: Yes, I understand. I will set the environment variable myself.
options.description: I will set the correct environment variable prior to starting up the docker-compose setup.

options.name: no
options.displayName: Yes, I understand. I will provide the key with each request.
options.description: No environment variable placeholder will be added. I will provide the key with each request using the X-Cohere-Api-Key header.

parameters.name: image_neural_model
parameters.description: Select the image vectorization model for your Weaviate instance.

options.name: pytorch-resnet50
options.description: Pytorch-based models work with CUDA-GPU or CPU. They can run on amd64 and arm64 architecture. Inference is single-threaded.

options.name: keras-resnet50
options.description: Keras-based models are restricted to amd64 and CPU at the moment. They allow for multi-threaded inference.

parameters.name: runtime
parameters.description: You can use this configuration generator to generate template for various runtimes.
